history.content:
I personally thought CS 170 built much more heavily on 61b material than 70 material, so I would discourage taking 170 concurrently with 61b. Right from the beginning, the course assumes fluency with most data structures and a lot of algorithms from 61b like dfs, dijkstra, etc.



While I think 170 does help you a lot with interviews, I think you're better off studying the 61b material and then getting a book like CTCI


---


I have a friend who took 61B/170 concurrently and they regret it. As stated above I wouldn't recommend it.

------

Took 61B and 170 concurrently last semester. I was fine, but that's because I knew most, if not all of both 61B and 170 material beforehand. Unless you know that you fall into my category, or are an absolute genius (i.e. extremely strong in math), don't do it. Yes, 170 is helpful, but you need that grounding in 61B first. I would go so far as to say that for the average student, taking 170 with 61B would be a colossal disaster. 


p.s. if you have to ask, it's probably too much

I personally thought CS 170 built much more heavily on 61b material than 70 material, so I would discourage taking 170 concurrently with 61b. Right from the beginning, the course assumes fluency with most data structures and a lot of algorithms from 61b like dfs, dijkstra, etc.

While I think 170 does help you a lot with interviews, I think you're better off studying the 61b material and then getting a book like CTCI

I am an incoming sophomore majoring in EECS. I heard that CS170 is very useful for interviews, so I want to take it in the fall. However, I haven't taken 61B yet, and I also plan to take that in the fall. So how bad is it to take them both at the same time? And, is it worth taking 170 in the fall just to do better with interviews or should I leave it until the spring? I am planning to read through the 61B material during the summer if that helps.

Background about me: (I will have taken 61A and 70 by fall).

Thanks in advance.
history.subject: Taking CS61B and CS170 at the same time
